result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter Joseph Megna

records.addlTxt: Plea date on December 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Defendant Walter Joseph Megna appeared by video.  Attorney Jordan Feest appears by video for Jacalyn Christie Labre for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Walter Joseph Megna.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:   September 9, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-04-22 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:10 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Walter Joseph Megna appeared by video.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-25-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 1.
Warrant canceled and original returned to Clerk's office.

Defendant appears, via Zoom voluntarily, on warrant.  Initial appearance is set for 06-27-2022.  Recognizance bond is continued with the added condition that he not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license and without an IID installed.  Amended bond to be signed when he comes in for his IA on Monday 06-27.
MTPD/Katie at dispatch was contacted to cancel/return warrant.
Minutes.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:38 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Walter Joseph Megna not in court.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing in court.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 4 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
